meanings.definition: Past tense of blowtorch: to use a blowtorch to apply heat to something
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he blowtorched the metal to make it bend easily.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully blowtorched the top of the creme brulee to create a caramelized crust.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician accidentally blowtorched his own hat during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to blowtorch the pavement, making it too hot to walk on barefoot.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith expertly blowtorched the iron to shape it into a horseshoe.

meanings.definition: Adjective: treated or cooked with a blowtorch
meanings.sent1: The blowtorched steak had a delicious charred flavor.
meanings.sent2: The blowtorched edges of the wooden sign gave it a rustic look.
meanings.sent3: The blowtorched marshmallows were a hit at the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The blowtorched metal sculpture gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The blowtorched dessert had a unique smoky aroma.

meanings.definition: Verb: to subject something to the action of a blowtorch
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully blowtorched the edges of the paper to create a burnt effect.
meanings.sent2: The welder blowtorched the joint to ensure a strong bond.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully blowtorched the marshmallows for the s'mores.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter had to blowtorch the door to rescue the trapped cat.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler skillfully blowtorched the silver to shape it into a ring.
